titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Methodist Minister's marriage and baptism record book 1978.050
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-12-28 16:39:03 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Methodist Minister's marriage and baptism record book
did.abstract: A Methodist minister's record book of baptisms (1844-1892) and marriages (1844-1891) in New York City and Long Island.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of New Canaan Historical Society, 1975. The Society had received the volume from Nathan Chatterton in 1961.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single volume.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Methodist minister's marriage and baptism record book, 1844-1892, 1978.050, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A Methodist minister's record book of baptisms (1844-1892) and marriages (1844-1891) in New York City and Long Island. Neither the name of the minister nor the churches with which he was affiliated are specified; however, the book was originally donated by Nathan Chatterton of New Canaan, CT, a descendant of the New York Methodist minister John C. Chatterton, so it seems likely that the book belonged to him.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This item is in the public domain. While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
